text: VTV3 is a Vietnamese television station operated and owned by government-owned VTV Network. It launched on 31 March 1996 as the country's first entertainment channel, as well as American and Asian series. == Broadcast == * VTV3 was broadcast by Vietnam Television for testing, the remaining programs will be broadcast at the same frequency range of VTV1 and VTV2, with the content is Sports - Entertainment - Economic Information. The channel was broadcast on channel 6 in Hanoi. Broadcast time was from 6:00 pm to 12:00 am. The channel began to be relayed nationwide via satellite on 31 March 1998. * Until 31 December 2001: ** From Monday to Friday: 12:00pm to 12:00am ** Saturday and Sunday: 10:00am to 12:00am * From 31 December 2001 to 31 August 2006: 06:00am to 12:00am * From 1 September 2006 to 18 March 2020 and from 1 May 2020 to present: 24/7. * From 19 March 2020 to 30 April 2020: 05:00am to 12:00am == VTV3 HD == VTV3 became the first channel of VTV and the first commercial television channel in Vietnam to have an HD simulcast. VTV3 HD was soft- launched from 31 March 2013 to mark VTV3's 17th anniversary and was officially launched on 1 June 2013. Most programs broadcast by VTV3 since 2013 are in HDTV with a 16:9 picture format. Vietnam television broadened sports room from the sports-entertainment-economic information. Sports moved to VTV6 in 2016 == List of programs currently broadcast by VTV3 == Details: List of television programmes broadcast by Vietnam Television (VTV) *Cà phê sáng với VTV3 (Morning Café with VTV3) *Ai là triệu phú - Who Wants To Be A Millionaire *Không giới hạn - Sasuke Vietnam (Vietnamese ninja warrior) *Vui - Khoẻ - Có ích (Be Happy, Be Well & Be Meaningful, November 2004 – present) *Đường lên đỉnh Olympia (Road to Mount Olympia/Digital LG quiz Vietnam) * Hãy chọn giá đúng - The Price Is Right * Hành Khách Cuối Cùng - The Last Passenger * Tường lửa - The Wall * Trò chơi âm nhạc - The Lyrics Board - Don't Forget The Lyrics === Former === # Bố ơi! Mẹ thích gì? (2014-2016) # Chiếc nón kỳ diệu - Wheel of Fortune (2001-2016) # UEFA Champions League, UEFA Europa League (1998-2015, 2016-2017) ==See also== * List of television programmes broadcast by Vietnam Television (VTV) * List of television programmes broadcast by VTV3 ==Notes== ==References== Category:Vietnam Television Category:Television channels and stations established in 1996 Category:Sports television networks Category:Television networks in Vietnam
title: VTV3
